title: How to complete the PCM of class 12 in one month - Quora

response.answer_text: Nice question but this require lots of practice . If you know a little bit about your subjects ,chapters and concept involved it will be great help for you ,for short and precise preparation in 1 month . First of all very carefully analyse previous years question asked in board exams , mark the chapters with greater weightage , get your maximum focus/ concentration on those chapters in pcm .No need to get panic ,go ahead by step by step ,keep your focus for at least 1 month , don't try to study each and every topic in depth . If you follows as I suggested you above ,you will definately get good marks but remember all things get boil down to the level of hard work that you put in your preparation . BEST OF LUCK

Dont want to demotivate you,but its next to impossible for anyone to complete 12th that too PCM in a month, untill & unless you got focud & determination. Bump into last 10–15 years Question papers. Maths, will be completed in this way y& you can score 50–55+. For chemistry, concentrate on Physical portion(first 5 chapters) , so that you'll be confident on 23 marks. Then, pick chapters like polymers, biomolecules & chem. In everyday life. & if you left with time, read inorganic portion (d,p,f block). Dont go for organic, it will ruin your preparation. For physics, Try completing first book & last 10 years ques. Papers. Thatsit ! All the best .

Create plans for each subject exactly for 9 days. In the plan, first 4 days go with important topics. The remaining topics for 3 days. At the end, test yourself with the previous question papers. You will have 2 more days for improving you with the question papers. You still have time to change your marks. But never deviate from the timetable. All the best!!! It is advised to have a good contact with a staff who will help you in doubts.
To be honest it's impossible if you don't know anything. If you know like even 40% of the total course then your tuition teacher can help you. Hope this helps. All d best for boards.
There are many YouTube channels like PHYSICS BABA from where you can learn all derivations and Numericals for Physics.For More Detail: WWW.PHYSICSKNOWLEDGE.COM
